intro: Ranunculus schurianus, commonly known as the Schurian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with 5 to 15 petals and a central cluster of stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is part of the Ranunculaceae family. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the stems are usually hairy. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring.
